summary: Financial firms in Britain will be able to test artificial intelligence tools later this year . The Financial Conduct Authority has partnered with U.S. chipmaker Nvidia to provide access to advanced computing power and bespoke AI software . A sandbox refers to a controlled environment where companies can test new ideas such as products, services or technologies .  Nvidia said the initiative would allow firms to explore AI-powered innovations in a secure environment, using its accelerated computing platform . "AI is fundamentally reshaping the financial sector," said Jochen Papenbrock, EMEA head of financial technology .  Testing is set to begin in October with the first phase set to be completed in October . Testing is due to begin for the first time this year in the U.S.

CoreWeave has made a splash in the market as it quickly grows its cloud services business . Shares of the AI hyperscaler providing cloud services have soared about 185% in just the past month . Nvidia is proving its AI lineup of products is becoming more and more pervasive .  Sales of its advanced chips in the data center segment had been growing like a weed . Revenue in that segment has been increasing in each consecutive quarter for the last two years . In the most recent fiscal quarter, that growth rate slowed to 10%, though . Despite that trend, it's clear AI demand hasn't yet peaked .  Nvidia also invests in the AI sector . One of the AI companies in which Nvidia holds a stake is CoreWeave . The company leases data center space to companies needing the compute power from the 250,000 Nvidia chips .  CoreWeave announced a new lease agreement to further increase capacity . The company has the option to expand the load by an additional 150 MW in the future . Last year,Microsoft accounted for nearly two-thirds of revenue .  CoreWeave stock trades at a high valuation after the stock has soared . It recently had a price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of about 30 . Nvidia has about $5.4 billion of liquidity available as of March 31 and raised another $2 billion from a late May debt offering . The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $669,517!  The Motley Fool recommends Nintendo and recommends the following options: long January 2026 $395 calls on Microsoft and short January 20 26 $405 calls on Nvidia .

Applied Digital shares have formed a cup and handle on the chart, with the price staging a decisive breakout above the pattern’s top trendline last week . The company said it expects the deal, which will see it host CoreWeave AI infrastructure at its Ellendale, N.D., campus, to generate $7 billion in total revenue over 15 years .  Applied Digital shares gained 103% last week, closing Friday at $13.86 . The stock has more than tripled over the past 12 months, boosted by expectations that the company sits well placed to capitalize on booming demand for AI infrastructure .  Applied Digital’s chart to watch amid recent rally and locate a majorsupport level worth monitoring during potential pullbacks . Further buying momentum could see the shares initially climb to the $17 area . This location on the chart may provide overhead selling pressure near a series of prices situated around the stock's April 2022countertrendhigh . A close above this level could fuel a rally toward $28 .  Investors should keep a close eye on the $10.50 level . Those who prefer not to chase breakouts may seek buying opportunities near the cup and handle pattern’s top trendline .

Amazon Web Services isn't betting on one large language model (LLM) winning the AI race . Instead, it's offering customers a buffet of models to choose from . The cloud computing arm of Amazon aims to become the go-to infrastructure layer for the AI economy .  Two years after its launch, Bedrock is now the fastest-growing service offered by AWS . It's why Amazon CEO Andy Jassy sees Bedrock as a core part of the company’s AI growth strategy .  Amazon created the project Bedrock. known as Code Whisperer, launched in 2023 . The team realized they could offer the service for a broader set of use cases . Many analysts don't consider Amazon to be leading the AI race, even though it has ramped up its spending .  In November 2024, Amazon doubled its investment in Anthropic to $8 billion in a deal that requires it to train its large language model, Claude, using primarily AWS’s chips . The deal allows Amazon to prove out its AI training infrastructure and deepen ties with one LLM provider .  Revenue at AWS increased 16.9% to $29.27 billion in Q1, marking the third time in a row it missed analyst estimates despite double-digit growth . The Anthropic partnership underscores a bigger competition AWS may be fighting with chipmakers .  AWS doesn’t break out its costs for AI, CEO Andy Jassy said in February that the “vast majority of that capex spend is on AI for AWS” It’s a bet that Amazon is willing to spend on .  Anthropic is AWS's sole training partner . We also clarified the relationship between CodeWhisperer and Bedrock . We regret the errors .

NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA) develops computing, graphics, and networking technologies . Overall, NVDAranks 4thon our list of stocks that Jim Cramer discusses . Cramer said if the president wants to win, he needs to “show his trump card, NVIDIA”  If you are looking for an extremely cheap AI stock that is also a major beneficiary of Trump tariffs and onshoring, see our free report on the best short-term AI stock .

NVIDIA Corporation’s leading position in the artificial intelligence (AI) chip market has helped the company report consistent positive earnings results in recent years, propelling its share price . The quantum computing market is expected to exceed $1 trillion in value by 2035, according to McKinsey & Company . One of the major players in this area isIonQ, Inc. whose shares have surged 374.7% over the past year .  IONQ generates consistent revenues due to its unique linear ion chains in quantum computing, enabling it to surpass 100 qubits and minimize errors in comparison to other quantum computers . The company’s CEO, Niccolo de Masi, is optimistic about the company's future . However, its first-quarter revenues were unimpressive and the company has yet to achieve profitability .  IONQ’s revenues have witnessed a CAGR of 170% since 2021 . However, real-world applications of quantum computing are still years away, lengthening the path to profitability and increasing risk . NVIDIA, since its initial public offering (IPO) not only reported revenue growth but also improved profit margins .  Presently, IONQ has a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) and its expected earnings growth rate for the current year is 69.9% . The company's scalability and competitive edge, attracting risk-tolerant investors to consider buying IonQ stock .

White House National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett expects a deal structured around rare earth minerals and semiconductors . Hassett said he doesn't expect the U.S. to lift restrictions on the sale of Nvidia H20 chips in China .  Nvidia shares were recently up about 0.8%, while chipmaking rivals Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and Intel (INTC) added 3.5% and 2.8% respectively . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, who is also in London for London Tech Week, has called the export curbs a “failure”

Trade talks between the US and China stretched on in London . The US signaled a willingness to remove restrictions on some tech exports in exchange for assurances that China is easing limits on rare earth shipments . Bags of food from the upscale eatery Ottolenghi were brought into the building where negotiators were holding discussions .  Kevin Hassett, head of the White House’s National Economic Council, said the US will be eased and the rare earths will be released in volume” by China, he said . But Hassett said that the US would stop short of including the most sophisticated US chips made by Nvidia Corp. used to power artificial intelligence .  First round of negotiations since teams met a month ago is aimed at restoring confidence that both are living up to commitments made in Geneva . Washington and Beijing agreed to lower crippling tariffs for 90 days to allow time to hammer out ways to address trade imbalance .  A phone call last week between President Donald Trump and his counterpart Xi Jinping appeared to give fresh momentum to reviving talks and reaching a deal . On Monday, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will meet a Chinese delegation .  Chinese government figures showed exports rose less than expected last month as the worst drop in shipments to the US in more than five years . In the US, job growth moderated in May and the prior months were revised lower .  The SEC Pinned its Hack on a few Hapless Day Traders, the SEC says . America Cast Itself as the World’s Moral Leader. Not Anymore .

Washington signals it might loosen some tech export rules but only if Beijing opens the gate on rare earth shipments . This isn't a new deal, it's an attempt to revive the shaky framework from Geneva, where both sides paused tariff hikes to cool the temperature .  Monday's meeting could roll into Tuesday, and markets are already responding . Chinese stocks in Hong Kong surged into bull market territory, while US stocks wavered on cautious optimism . China just posted its worst export numbers to the US in five years, and US manufacturers especially in the Midwest continue to feel the squeeze .

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huangsaid Monday the United Kingdom is in a "Goldilocks circumstance" for artificial intelligence . He confirmed new investment plans in the country's AI sector . The remarks come as Labour government advances policies to support domestic AI development .

NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang and U.K. Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer kicked off London Tech Week on Monday . Huang emphasized AI’s transformative potential across various sectors, predicting that "every industry in the U.S. will be a tech industry" by 2030 .  NVIDIA Deep Learning Institute will support a national AI skills initiative, training developers in advanced AI techniques . The Isambard AI supercomputer, powered by NVIDIA, is expected to become operational this summer . The U.K.’s Financial Conduct Authority is incorporating NVIDIA technology into its innovation sandbox .  The U.K. government has announced an investment of approximately £1 billion in AI research by 2030 . The investment aligns with Prime Minister Starmer’s vision of "sovereign AI ambitions," which encompasses more than technology . In Sweden, Germany, and France, NVIDIA is collaborating with various partners to build national AI infrastructures and supercomputers .  Jensen Huang will deliver a keynote address, with a livestream available globally . The event is set to feature discussions on NVIDIA Blackwell, sovereign AI initiatives, and new regional partnerships .

Jensen Huang, CEO of semiconductor giant Nvidia, said it was ‘vital’ to invest in the UK . UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the UK is in a “goldilocks circumstance” given its access to a rich AI community . Huang said the biggest factor holding the UK back was its lack of infrastructure .  Huang said Nvidia was ready to invest in the UK by launching an AI lab to help “start off the AI ecosystem and infrastructure” Nscale, a British cloud computing provider, announced it would develop AI infrastructure with 10,000 Nvidia Blackwell graphics processing units by 2026 .  Nvidia CEO describes AI as "the great equaliser", predicting every industry in the UK would eventually be a tech industry . He added that chatbot aspect of large language models democratised technology, because there is no need to know a more complicated coding language anymore . CoreWeave, Inc. (CRWV)'s share was trading at $ 135.05 as of 5thJune . Company pivoted from crypto mining to cloud computing in 2022, just as demand for accelerated AI workloads began to explode . Company now operates 32 data centers with over 250,000 Nvidia GPUs and more than 360 MW of active power .  CoreWeave's Kubernetes-native platform is purpose-built for AI and delivers significantly higher performance . Its business model centers on long-term, take-or-pay contracts averaging four years in duration . 96% of 2024 revenue underpinned by these commitments .  CrowdStrike (CRWD) faces scrutiny over its elevated valuation and operational headwinds . CoreWeave (CRWV) offers a contrasting AI infrastructure bet rooted in explosive growth and Nvidia alignment . Viewed together, CRWD and CRWV offer a study in contrasting AI exposure .  CoreWeave, Inc. (CRWV) is not on our list of the30 Most Popular Stocks Among Hedge Funds . 36 hedge fund portfolios held CRWV at the end of the first quarter which was 0 in the previous quarter .

Israeli chip startup Speedata secured a $44 million Series B round, bringing its total funding to $114 million . The round was led by existing investors, including Walden Catalyst Ventures,83North,Koch Disruptive Technologies,Pitango First, and Viola Ventures . At the heart of Speedata's innovation is the analytics processing unit, a dedicated chip designed to accelerate data .  Speedata's analytics processing unit was engineered solely for analytics performance . In one pharmaceutical test case, Speedata’s APU completed a complex data workload in just 19 minutes, compared to 90 hours using conventional hardware .  Speedata was founded in 2019 by six engineers, including early researchers of multi-threaded coarse-grained reconfigurable architecture . The APU currently supports Apache Spark, with a product roadmap that includes integration across major analytics platforms . Speedata aims to position its APU as the industry standard for processing analytics data .  Speedata plans to showcase its APU publicly for the first time at Databricks’ Data & AI Summit . The startup is expanding its go-to-market operations and growing its pipeline of enterprise clients eager to transition to faster and more efficient data processing .  Israeli chip startup Speedata raises $44M to challenge Nvidia's AI Dominance with 280x Faster Analytics Processor . Get the latest stock analysis from INTEL (INTC): Free Stock Analysis Report .

IonQ (IONQ) announced the acquisition of a UK rival Monday . IonQ said Monday it reached a deal to acquire UK quantum computing firm Oxford Ionics in a $1.08 billion deal . The move “accelerates our mission to full fault-tolerant quantum computers with 2 million physical qubits and 80,000 logical qubits by 2030”  IonQ said it will present further results this week at the ISC High Performance conference in Hamburg, Germany . CEO Niccolo de Masi said aims tobecome the Nvidiaof quantum computing .

Palantir Technologies Inc. has surged 69% year to date, eclipsing the industry’s modest 13% average . Nvidia, a leading force in AI and graphics processing technology, has recorded a 6% gain so far this year . Similarly, Oracle, renowned for its enterprise software and cloud infrastructure services, has gained 5% .  Palantir's annual run rate past the $1 billion mark for the first time . U.S. commercial revenues skyrocketed 71% year over year and 19% sequentially in the first quarter of 2025 . The rising popularity of AIP bootcamps, short, targeted training sessions for enterprise AI deployment .  Palantir boasts $5.4 billion in cash and no debt . First quarter sales soared 39.3% YoY . The Zacks Consensus Estimate for second-quarter 2025 EPS stands at 14 cents . Full-year earnings are projected to grow 44% in 2025 and 25% in 2026 .  Palantir is proving itself as a real contender in AI-powered enterprise solutions . While the growth story is compelling, the stock is priced for near-flawless execution, leaving minimal margin for error . While long-term investors should hold onto their positions, chasing the stock at these levels could prove risky . PLTR currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold)  NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) and Oracle Corporation (ORCL) are among the top-ranked companies in the world . NVIDIA, Oracle and Palantir Technologies (PLTR) are all on the same track as NVIDIA and Oracle .

Intel CorporationINTC has plunged 35.1% over the past year against the industry’s growth of 12.3%, lagging its peers . While NVIDIA stock is up 16.4%, Advanced Micro has declined 27.5% over this period .  Intel has been facing challenges due to the disruptive rise of over-the-top service providers in this dynamic industry . China accounted for more than 29% of Intel's total revenues in 2024, making it the single largest market for the company .  Chinese directive to phase out foreign chips from key telecom networks by 2027 underscores Beijing's accelerating efforts to reduce reliance on Western technology amid escalating U.S.-China trade and tariff tensions . Earnings estimates for Intel for 2025 have moved down 40.8% to 29 cents .  Intel is investing to expand its manufacturing capacity to accelerate its IDM 2.0 (Integrated Device Manufacturing) strategy . Intel's innovative AI solutions are set to benefit the broader semiconductor ecosystem by driving down costs, improving performance and fostering an open, scalable AI environment .  Intel Xeon platforms reportedly set the benchmark in 5G cloud-native core with substantial performance and power-efficiency improvements . The funds will support Intel in advancing critical semiconductor manufacturing and advanced packaging projects in Arizona, New Mexico, Ohio and Oregon .  Management is focusing on simplifying parts of its portfolio to unlock efficiencies and create value . Recent product launches appear “too little, too late” for Intel . Declining earnings estimates remain an overhang . Investors could be better off if they exercise caution and stay invested for long-term gains .  Zacks Investment Research: St. Louis-area companies are best-known in the U.S. market . This article was originally published by Zacks.com .

Sir Keir Starmer declared Britain was ‘unequivocally, unashamedly and defiantly open for business’ But Alphawave, a British semiconductor company, announced it was set to become the latest tech business to quit the London stock market after revealing its £1.8bn sale to American rival Qualcomm .  Alphawave went public the same year as Deliveroo, a fast food delivery app that went public . Deliveroo also served itself up for a £7.6bn takeover by US competitor DoorDash last month .  Prime Minister has sought to link AI directly to the lives of citizens . Nvidia’s Huang argued that the UK was in the “goldilocks’ zone” with great universities, a good start-up culture and the third-largest amount of investment in AI companies .  Britain has consistently struggled to nurture technology companies from start-up to ‘scale up” stage . Whereas the US has created titans such as Google, OpenAI, Amazon and Facebook owner Meta, few such champions exist in the UK . Many of those that have emerged over the years have been sold off or opt to list on the other side of the Atlantic .  Some of Britain’s brightest tech start-ups have shunned the City and preferred to remain private . Many of those that are now considering a listing could go elsewhere .  Shadow business secretary Andrew Griffith argues that the loss of prestigious listings is “symptomatic of a ‘vibe shift’ away from London’s capital . Brent Hoberman, the dotcom investor who co-founded Lastminute.com, agrees that part of the problem is a culture and tax regime that treats entrepreneurs too harshly .  UK millionaires have recently left the UK, amid a recent exodus of millionaires . Orlando Bravo, managing partner of tech-focused investor Thoma Bravo, also recently claimed that the strict rules governing London-listed companies makes it unnecessarily difficult to buy them .  Baroness Gustafsson was chief executive of Darktrace until recently . She joined Sir Keir at the opening of London Tech Week but said little other than the pre-prepared questions .

Britain's Financial Conduct Authority announces partnership with Nvidia . Supercharged Sandbox program will give selected firms access to Nvidia's full-stack accelerated computing platform, AI software, and better datasets in a secure, regulatory-compliant environment .  AI is fundamentally reshaping the financial sector, said Jochen Papenbrock, Nvidia's EMEA head of financial technology . The partnership follows UK Finance Minister Rachel Reeves' push for regulators to remove barriers to economic expansion .

A multi-billion-dollar plan to build a massiveAI datacenter hub in the UAE using U.S. technology remains far from finalized due to unresolved security concerns . The project, dubbed Stargate UAE, brings together Nvidia, Oracle, OpenAI, Cisco Systems, SoftBank Group and Abu Dhabi's G42 . The entire 10-square-mile site will eventually host up to 5 gigawatts worth of data centers .  Stargate UAE is a strategic move to anchor high-performance compute in the Middle East . However, lingering concerns about the UAE's close ties to China and past use of Huawei technology continue to stall progress .  GuruFocus. appeared on GuruFocus.com . Sterling Infrastructure, Inc. has steadily carved out a strong position in the data-center construction space . At the end of the first quarter, the company's total backlog was $2.1 billion . E-Infrastructure Solutions accounted for $1.2 billion, representing approximately 57% of the total backlog .  Sterling's E-Infrastructure segment showed solid growth in the first quarter of 2025 . Data-center projects now represent more than 65% of the segment’s backlog . Jacobs Solutions Inc.J andDycom Industries, Inc.DY are among the key competitors positioned to capitalize on the rising demand for data-center infrastructure .  In the first quarter of 2025, the company reported double-digit revenue growth in both life sciences and data-center markets . Sterling stock has jumped 12.4% in a month, outpacing the Zacks Engineering - R and D Services industry’s rise of 6.8% .  STRL is currently trading at a premium with a price-to-earnings ratio of 23.21X compared with the industry’s average of 20.43X . STRL currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) STRL's 2025 and 2026 earnings estimates have remained unchanged in the past 30 days . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the UK is in a "Goldilocks" situation when it comes to artificial intelligence (AI) Huang made the comments on a panel with UK prime minister Keir Starmer and minister for investment Poppy Gustafsson at the start of London Tech Week .  Huang said the UK has the "third largest AI venture capital (VC) investment anywhere in the world" Synthesia and AI voice generator start-up ElevenLabs were the other names Huang mentioned . In a speech prior to the panel, opening London Tech Week, Starmer said the government was committing an extra £1bn of funding to scale up the UK's computing power by 20 times .  Prime Minister unveils government partnership with 11 major companies to train 7.5 million workers in AI by 2030 . Huang: "The UK is such an incredible, incredible place to invest: I'm gonna invest here"  UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) launches a "supercharged sandbox" to allow City firms to experiment with AI . FCA says those successful in applying to use the "sandbox" would be able to do so from October .

The artificial intelligence industry is experiencing rapid growth, with hundreds of billions of dollars at stake . Nvidia and Amazon have reported stellar earnings, driven by demand for data centers and cloud computing . Big Tech companies are expected to spend $325 billion this year, a significant increase over $223 billion invested in 2024 .  Nvidia's data center revenue grew 73% year over year in the recently announced fiscal first quarter of 2026, reaching $39 billion . Total sales increased to $44 billion, representing 69% growth .  Nvidia expects $45 billion in sales for Q2 of fiscal 2026, representing a 50% year-over-year increase . Nvidia stock currently trades with a price-to-earnings ratio of 46, well below its three-year average of 80 .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the largest cloud services provider on Earth . In Q1, AWS provided 63% of Amazon's $18.4 billion in operating profits . Sales reached $29 billion, driven by robust 17% year-over-year growth .  This appears to be an excellent opportunity for investors to purchase shares that are at least fairly valued, and possibly undervalued . The AI industry is growing rapidly, and these industry titans will continue to benefit tremendously . Economic policy, such as tariffs, remains a wild card that investors should keep an eye on . Board member Mark A. Stevens sold more than $149 million worth of company shares last week . Stevens, a longtime board director and tech investor, has previously reduced his stake in the chipmaker .  NVIDIA maintains a conservative debt position, with a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.12, below the sector average . Stevens' sizable share sale may raise eyebrows among investors, but it doesn't necessarily signal trouble for NVIDIA's fundamentals .

Nvidia provided new clarity on key investor concerns during a private investor dinner hosted by Bank of America in San Francisco . Blackwell NVL rack systems were said to be fully ramped as of June 5, with roughly 70% of Nvidia's compute sales in fiscal Q1 tied to the platform . Production of Blackwell Ultra will begin in the current quarter, with volume expected to rise in the second half .  Nvidia's total addressable data center market opportunity between $250 billion and $350 billion, based on third-party projections of 5 to 7 gigawatts of new capacity in 2025 . The easing of sovereign AI restrictions was also seen as a tailwind, with Nvidia able to serve government-backed AI demand either directly or through cloud and enterprise intermediaries .  Nvidia previously reported fiscal Q1 revenue of $44.1 billion, up 69% year over year . Scale, and developer support are key reasons for sustained upside in the AI cycle .

AdaCore has announced the introduction of the Ada and SPARK programming languages into the automotive market . AdaCore says it is set to publish an off-the-shelf reference process . Nvidia developed Drive OS, the reference operating system and associated software stack designed specifically for developing and deploying autonomous vehicle applications .  At the heart of the standard are Automotive Safety Integrity Levels (ASILs), which classify potential hazards from A (lowest) to D (highest) based on severity, exposure, and controllability . The higher the ASIL, the more rigorous the required development and verification processes .  The ISO-26262 reference process is available onhttps://nvidia.io/spark-process/ and can be used or customized freely by anyone interested in adopting these languages .

Supermicro's DLC technology offers huge cost savings for companies constructing data centers . Supermicro faces some headwinds due to tariffs . Supermico's stock looks cheap compared to many other AI players .  Supermicro's racks are highly modular, allowing clients of all sizes to find a server rack that fits their workload size and application . The company's direct liquid-cooling (DLC) technology is a far more efficient way to cool its server racks .  In Supermicro's third quarter of fiscal year 2025 (ended March 31), sales rose 19% year over year to $4.6 billion . Supermicro also has key partnerships in the industry, most notably with Nvidia's most powerful chip, based on Blackwell architecture, can be placed in servers purpose-built to hold those exact GPUs .  As Supermicro figures out tariffs and shifts supply chains around, it could see its growth start to reaccelerate . Nvidia forecast, using third-party data, that data center capital expenditures would reach $400 billion in 2024 but could rise to $1 trillion by 2028 . That kind of growth could send Supermicro's stock soaring .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is792% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to173% for the S&P 500 . The technology sector has helped lead the market higher over the past decade . With new technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI) and autonomous driving continuing to emerge, there is every reason to believe it can do the same over the next decade .  Nvidia has built a collection of tools and libraries that help improve the performance of its GPU for use in running AI workloads . This has helped give the company a dominant market share in the GPU space of more than 80%.  Alphabet is not without its risks, as some investors fret over AI disrupting its search business . However, the company has a collection of very attractive businesses . Its YouTube business is not only the most-watched streaming platform, but it is also one of the largest digital advertising platforms .  Google has a large distribution and ad network advantage that should not be overlooked . It has spent decades building one of the largest ad markets on the planet . Alphabet also knows how to monetize search better than any company . It's focused on profiting from queries that have commercial intent .  Salesforce is setting its sights on becoming a leader in AI agents through its new Agentforce platform . With unmatched distribution, a massive ad network, and a focus on commerce monetization, Alphabet is well situated to be an AI search winner .  Salesforce is looking to lead a digital labor revolution . It plans to accomplish this through its ADAM framework that combines agents, data, apps, and metadata into one platform . Agentic AI is a competitive space, but Salesforce looks like it has the platform to be a winner . AMD just acquired Brium, an AI software company . The stock is reasonably priced after falling sharply over the last year . Revenue in the AI-focused segment jumped 57% in its first quarter to $3.7 billion .  AMD has announced the acquisition of AI software company Brium . The deal is AMD's fourth AI acquisition in the last two years . AMD also announced it would sell its server manufacturing business to Sanmina .  AMD's success in the future will be determined in large part by how it competes in AI and whether it can close the gap with Nvidia in programming software and other capabilities . The company is likely to continue making acquisitions .  AMD reported revenue growth of 36% to $7.44 billion in its first quarter . Hyperscalers likeOracleand Google Cloud are expanding deployments of EPYC CPUs . AMD isn't a sure thing in AI, but the company has a history of success under CEO Lisa Su . Nvidia has been the biggest beneficiary of the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) AI can add up to $15.7 trillion to the global economy come 2030 . One of the linchpins of Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's growth strategy is to debut an advanced graphics processing unit (GPU) every year .  PwC's estimate that AI will add $15.7 trillion to the global economy in 2030 . No company has been a bigger beneficiary of the AI revolution than Nvidia . The potential problem is that one of Nvidia's biggest perceived competitive advantages might also be its undoing .  Nvidia's outperformance is directly reflective of its ideal positioning in AI-accelerated data centers . With demand for AI-GPUs handily swamping supply, Wall Street's AI darling has been able to charge a veritable arm and a leg for its hardware .  Nvidia saw its GAAP gross margin explode to as high as 78.4% in the fiscal first quarter one year ago . CEO Jensen Huang's aggressive ambition is to bring a next-generation AI chip to market on an annual basis .  Huang wants to keep Nvidia in its decisive leadership position on the compute front . Huang's aggressive spending on research to develop faster and more efficient AI-GPUs is something that Wall Street and investors would almost universally cheer . But there's a very real possibility that Jensen Huang's accelerated innovation timeline may do more harm than good for his company .  Many of Nvidia's leading customers by net sales within the Mag-7 are internally developing AI-GPUs and solutions of their own . The hardware isn't going to externally compete against Hopper, Blackwell, or the company's successor chips, it'll be notably cheaper than Nvidia's .  Jensen Huang's aggressive innovation cycle is also potentially damaging to data-center leasing models . Businesses wanting cutting-edge compute capabilities might pass on CoreWeave's data centers faster than investors might realize . The value of these chips will likely depreciate rapidly .
